Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Extremely comfortable, nice looks, good build, solid case, noise cancellation
Cons: Average sound quality, price, do not work with battery, flimsy cord
These are good, but not great headphones that cost $300. For $300, you could buy a PS3, a nice GPS, a surround sound system, or a small TV... so, I expected to get a nice piece of equipment for $300. For the most part, I was wrong... Here is what you get:
A good looking set of headphones that look and feel great. They are of great build quality, and extremely comfortable. The leather on the ear pads is super soft, almost luxurious. However, the cord is very thin and cheap looking. They fit snugly around my ears, so little ambient noise was able to enter. The noise cancellation feature worked pretty well with ambie ... nt noise such as jet engines. However, they don't cancel out random noise as well, such as people talking close by or load music. My Shure earbuds work better at blocking out that kind of noise. Also, the headphones don't work unless you have the noise cancelation switch on, which requires a battery (better have a spare on hand!). Overall, if you want these to block noise, I would recommend them. (Although $1 foam earplugs could do the same).
The most disappointing thing about these headphones was the sound quality. For $300, I could buy some great sounding speakers. However, great sounding is not what you get. They do have a good amount of bass; however, the bass is muddy and slow. There are also very poor highs. The treble clarity with music and voice is very poor in my opinion. It sounds like you are listening through a tin can. The mids are average, but not noteworthy. Overall, the sound produced by these headphones is average at best. My $100 Shure earbuds sound better in my opinion.
In conclusion, if you are looking for a comfortable pair of headphones to block out noise in a car or airplane, and don't care much about sound quality, these would work well for you. But, I still think you could do better for $300. For you audiophiles out there, trust me when I say "don't buy these!". You definitely do not get your monies worth. I guess what they say i ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Light weight, has it's own formed case, BLOCKS OUT THE NOISE!
Cons: A little pricy, case a little bulky, have to sleep with head straight if you have them on.
I was facing a 19 and a half hour trip to Shanghai, China! Although I was flying first class, I wanted some sort of noise reducing headphones. I read about Sennheiser, Dr. Dre, and some others. EVERY review kept bringing me back to the Bose QC15. The Sennheiser headphones were wireless ( which is what I wanted) but, you had to be near the receiver ! Well, the receiver was going to be packed!! Also, Sennheiser design allowed noise to be filtered through openings for breathability?!!! That would ALLOW NOISE! NO!! Dr. Dre, was just trendy and still didn't completely block out noise, according to reviews. There were r ... eviews re: the Bose QC15 that said that they were too "bassy" and/or not audio superior for sound quality, but did block out airplane noise. Well, I found them extremely superior in sound quality while watching videos and TV, the bass/ treble levels were extremely well balanced. No hissing or popping; smooth like melted chocolate. And OMG! I slept like a dead person on the plane! I didn't even realize that there was a crying baby in the "Elite" section until I took off the headphones!!! Those suckers REALLY BLOCKED OUT THE NOISE!! I couldn't even hear the flight attendant talking to me if I didn't remove them. AND he was leaning down really close to me!! WOW!!! THANK YOU, Bose!!! The headphones come with two different types of plugin cords; one for Apple devices, with a volume control, and a regular cord for a PC. It also comes with a jack adapter for airplane use. The case has formed inserts to cushion the headphones and keep them from being crushed inside of your luggage. Again, THESE ARE NOT WIRELESS! You have to plug them into your IPad, or IPHONE, Mac, or IPOD touch, or PC. But you know what? They more than delivered the two MOST IMPORTANT requirements: true noise reduction AND SUPERIOR audio quality!!! I decided to go back to Best Buy and get a pair for my hubby's birthday, who was waiting for me in Shanghai. :-) I made a GREAT decision on the Bose QC ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Noise cancelling and sound
Cons: Can't listen to music w/o noise canceling
I have owned and still do have earbuds and headphones from many companies but I actually needed good noise-canceling headphones.. I am not one to have a blind brand loyalty and I buy what's sounds good to me. I like my bass sweet and to be felt, but not to a degree that sounds like a dull, loud thud. But at the same time I like the highs to be crisp and sizzling with an overall sound that satisfies all my senses when you can hear all the instruments and the whole music as intended by the musicians. At first, I tried the brand new Klipsch Mode M-40 noise canceling headphones (Best Buy does not carry them) since I really like how the my Klipsch earbuds and headphones image one (Best Buy carries bot ... h) sound. I had to return the new Klipsch in two days and was very disappointed since they didn't produce the sound I liked, they were very heavy and extremely uncomfortable. They were expensive too $349. So I decided to give the Bose QuietComfort 15 a try after reading so many positive reviews of them. And yes, I found I was looking for. So far they have the best noise-canceling and it is very effective majority of the time. The only downside is you have to have that feature on all the time, when it is off you cannot listen to your music. The sound is great. The bass is just the way I like it, prominent, sweet, effective but not too overpowering. The highs are very clear and crisp with the mids being very clear. There was a roominess to the sounds. I tried different genres, different quality of music ranging from 160 kbs to 320 kbs and sound reproduction was great. They are also very comfortable and surrounded my ears softly. The cushions are very soft and comfortable. The looks of these are probably are not the best in the market but I myself do not care about the looks. They fold flat by rotating the ear cups and came with a fairly decent zippered bag for storage. For $299 they are a best buy from Best Buy and I would highly recommend them if your sound tastes are like mi ... expand » « collapse

OK I am an avid music listener of all different genres. However, if you are the kind of person who likes to feel the music as well as hear it, these headphones are not for you. despite the crystal clear sound, these headphones lack bass, which in my opinion allows you to really get the feel of the music. along with minimal bass, these also lack volume. I have to turn my ipod nearly all the way up to get the sound to my liking. I also have a pair of beats by dre. Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound quality, noise reduction, comfort, size, case
Cons: $300 is a lot for anything, but its worth it
I had been looking for a new pair of headphones to replace my older Bose ones, and I was torn between the Bose QC15s and the Dr. Dre Beats Studios. After months of research I finally decided that I would purchase the Bose headphones. This was a fantastic idea. Although the Beats are nice, the QC15s blow them out of the water. The headphones have amazing noise canceling abilities and also crystal clear sound quality. Yes, the bass is not as nice as it is on the Beats, but these headphones still have very clear bass. The overall sound quality is stunning with perfectly blended sounds and well rounded highs and lows. The treble on these headphones is very clear as well. A ... side from the music, the noise canceling is wonderful. There are two settings, hi and lo. These can be adjusted from a small switch on the base of the detachable cord. TIP: FOR BETTER NOISE CANCELING SELECT HI, FOR BETTER SOUND QUALITY SELECT LO. The noise cancellation feels like it literally sucks the noise out of your environment. What actually occurs is microphones on the outside of the headphones pick up exterior noise frequencies, and the headphones play (this process is silent of course) the opposite frequency to cancel out the exterior distraction. But, the user will still be able to hear faint human voice if they are close, and this is for safety purposes. Another advantage is that the cord from the headphones can be removed, so if the cord breaks, you do not have to buy another pair of $300 headphones. Also, the QC15s come with 2 chords, both work the same, but one specializes in ipods/ipads/iphones (it has an Apple control bar). I use the headphones with my Motorola Droid X and I have had only positive experiences throughout my usage. The headphones also come with an airplane adapter for travel, a very nice Bose carrying case, and 1 AAA battery, which the headphones run on. All together, these headphones are a great investment, and are worth every penny of the $300 that they cost. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: WOW! Way better than my Beats
Item.Review:
Little background on me. I am not an audiophile, but I consider myself wise enough to recognize what sounds good through a headphone and I listen to ALL kinds of music. I have had beats studio headphones since Christmas and have flown a few times with them. They sound decent and have good bass. Noise cancellation was good, but the worst thing was they leaked sound bad even at middle volume levels. I put up with it for awhile, but good too annoying to people around me who could hear every lyric. Plus they are a little clunky in size.
I finally decided this week to grab the Bose QC 15 to compare. And WOW! It is a night and day different sound. Bose was much more balanced when I played all types of music. I kept my iphone on one song at constant volume and switched back and forth betwe ... en each headphone. There was no doubt I would be keeping the Bose. The Beats sounded "muffled" like there was a blanket over the speaker. Bose was clear and good tone on all levels. I let my friends compare blindly and they agreed also. And of course the noise cancellation was awesome. Comfort is amazing also. Beats had a lil too heavy feel, and you could hear the parts moving when you move your head ( hard to explain unless you have tried them)
Bose case is much flatter, it only takes one AAA battery (included). Beats had a bulky case and took 2 batteries. These Bose should be much easier to store in my backpack now, and comes with 2 cables (regular and one w/inline remote) similar to the beats. For the same price I would pick the Bose 100% of the time over the Beats. Plus I felt personally a lil too old to have those hip-hop style. Loved the navy blue color, but will be selling the Beats now. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound quality and noise cancelling are incredible.
Cons: Price is a little steep
I travel quite a bit and wanted some headphones that would provide good sound for my music and movies and at the same time cancel some of the noise. I first bought the Phillips O'Neil headphones and they were good. Much better value for the product. I went to buy a pair for my wife for her birthday and they didn't carry them any longer. I bought the Bose QC 15 instead. I had been researching several products since I bought the Phillips set. Listening to the headphones in the store, I settled on the Bose because they were the same price as the Beats, but they appeared to be significantly better at noise canceling. Plus I figured if my wife didn't really like them or wanted to trade that woul ... d be okay with me. :D
We tried the headphones on a recent trip and it's easy to see (or should I say hear) why Bose is a leader in the market. When you activate the noise canceling it blocks out the majority of noise around you. When you add a little music or movie to it, you cannot hear anything around you; including engine noise on the plane. They really are that good.
These headphones come with a hard type carrying case and the ears fold in flat to make it easier to fit in your carry on luggage or computer bag. They also come with two different plugs. One has a microphone to use with your i-Products. Very convenient for Facetime with the family. Just remember the people around you at Starbucks can hear you even though you cannot hear them. (embarrassed myself a little. :) )
The headphones fit great. I have actually fallen asleep wearing them and did not have any discomfort when I woke up and realized I still had them on.
The sound quality is incredible. You can hear every syllable enunciated. The Beats have better low bass, but unless you just want to thump all of the time the Bose have a better overall sound quality in my opinion.
They are quite expensive. That didn't stop me from buying myself a set when I realized my wife was not going to give up hers or even consider t ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: I'm going to college this fall, and I need a pair of noise-cancelling headphones. First of all, I don't want to annoy my roommates by turning my laptop's speakers on. It took me a while to decide whether to buy Bose QC 15 or Dr.Beats Studio. Finally, I chose Bose because of its great sound quality, reputation, and noise-cancelling system. Things that are great about it: good noise-cancelling, nice design, very comfortable, and good bass. Things that aren't so great: battery life is kinda short.

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: If you're looking for great sound
Item.Review:
Pros: Quality, The Perfect Headphones
Cons: The price is a little steep.
I'm very picky about sound quality and these are perfect in my opinion. Exactly what I was looking for, these are one of the very few sets of headphones out there that will match (or beat) the sound of a good set of speakers/surround sound. I took awhile to look at some of the other headphones in the price range, hoping to maybe find some just as good for a little cheaper, but found none. Dr. Dre's headphones have a lot of bass, but its took much and doesn't sound good, it gets that vibrating booming bass. Not these though, perfect bass, plenty of boom but its the perfect sound, not too much.
Vocals sound amazing on these, much easier to hear, perfectly crisp and clear. I find myself enjoying acou ... stic songs on these headphones just because they sound so good.
Comfort is perfect on these, usually I can't listen to headphones for too long because they start to get annoying. Not these, I found myself wearing these for over 8 hours the other night when I was caught up in a work project. After all that the only thing was they were a little warm on my ears because they completely cover them.
Theres a Hi/Lo volume switch on the cord that goes inside the headphone and hides away nicely. This is good for times when you don't want the volume to go too loud. When on the Hi setting they do go very loud, sometimes you get those headphones that just don't go loud enough and they can be really annoying.
Although with these you don't really need to crank up the volume, the noise canceling on these is amazing. Just put them on your head and before you put on any music turn them on, as soon as it clicks in you can just hear the difference. They block everything out, even sounds that you didn't realize were there like the fan on your computer. You're in your own little audio world.
My only two complaints are very minimal. For one, the battery doesn't last that long in my opinion, although I do use them a lot. I've had them for about a 6 weeks and I've changed the battery twice. I ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Second Bose QC15 in our household.
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfort and sound deadening.
Cons: Price.
I purchased Sennheiser PXC-250 for me and the next year PXC-350 for my wife. Those are on-the-year style with a battery unit corded to the headset. These proved to be very uncomfortable and cumbersome with the cord and battery pack. I then purchased a QC15 for myself and they are SO much more comfortable with the over-the-ear design and NO battery pack. NO cord is required for just noise cancelling. You only plug in a cord for listening to music from whatever source. Not only that, they come with TWO cords. The second cord has a built-in microphone for use with devices like iPhone, iPad, or Androids that accept that type of connection. Perfect for Skyping.

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: As good as it gets for a prosumer
Item.Review: Got the QC15s, they have great sound quality and noise cancelling. I listen to them when studying and on the go, and they are awesome! They have an expensive feel, a detachable cable, and the LED tells you when you need to change the battery. They come with a nice case and an extra cable. Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Noise canceling!!! It's comfortable and light.
Cons: Price... I've heard couple better sounding headphones... They look like $35 headphones...
I have these headphones for couple months now so I believe, I have the knowledge to review them.
First of all, they look cheap, at least a lot cheaper than they really are. But it doesn't matter once you put them on your head (and turn them on...?# Let me begin with noise cancelling funcion since they've been made specificly for that feature. I must say, it's working more than great. I use them daily in my work and I want to point out that I have a horibly loud vacuum cleaner. I was kinda afraid that even these headphones would not give me enough noise cancelation to cut off that monster. Surprisingly, they did! I have ... another Bose headphones and I also use Zune for listening music. Previously, I needed to have the volume on 24/31 level to cut off #a little# my vacuum cleaner. Now I use 17/31 and I can hear a thing. Well, maybe a little quiet shhhhhh... However, I need to add that I wear glasses and I have to take them off in order to get the full noise canceling effect. Let's get to the sound. It's nice. The headphones are not perfectly flat #the bass is a little louder and the middle-low quiter# but they bring out every detail which I really like. However, I've heard better sounding headphones like Shure SRH840 that are more flat #studio headphones#. Concluding, Bose® QuietComfort® 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling® Headphones are good enough to excuse $300 price. They really look and feel like $35 headphones but they are comfortable #even with glasses on#, they sound almost perfect and the noise cancelling works better than you could expect.
P.S. You should buy some batteries #rechargable) to use them. However, the battery life is good enough - 2-3 weeks of daily use for like 3 hours. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural

Cons: Some of the features not included.
Most here have reviewed this product as being great except for the price. I'll be doing the same here. The sound is imaculate, and the wave length and ranges are perfect. The one issue I had with this product is that you can't use it without the noise cancelling. I use mine about 5-6 hours per day, and don't always need the noise cancelling aspect of the phones as it hurts my head a bit after about 4 hours. I also would like to point out that the battery runs out for me about every month or so, so that's not great.
All in all, I think they are great headphones, that still need improvement.
PS. The iPhone cord is amazing, and an awesome idea!

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: A must have for frequent flyers
Item.Review:
Pros: Noise cancelling for travel.
Cons: You have to remember to turn them off. No auto off
I fly at least two times a month and am on flights that are over 4 hours each way at least every other month. I like to watch movies on my IPAD and with the plane noise from the engines, it can be very difficult to hear with the earbuds that came with it. I have tried a couple other kind of earbuds and they weren't much better.
My biggest drawbacks from buying these were the price and also the size (I always pack a lot in my backpack and didn't want headphones taking up any more room). The headphones fold and the carrying case doesn't take up much room and it is nice for protecting the headphones as well as to to keep a spare battery in the zipper compartment along with the airl ... ine adapter jack.
I was amazed at the quality when I flew yesterday. With the earbuds, a lot of times I would have to have the volume up all the way on my ipad as well as pressing the earbuds in with my finger to help keep out noise from the plane engines. I was able to keep the volume down and hear the sound fine. I wanted to take a nap in the last part of the flight after the movie was over just left the headphones on and they did block most of the outside noise. I have trouble sleeping on planes, not only due to engine noise, but from flight announcements and hearing people nearby talkign and hearing people pass me when they are going to the lav. This blocked out all those noises and I didn't even hear the pilots or FA's announcement to discontinue the use of electronics and didn't realize it until the FA tapped me on the shoulder asking me to stow them, apparently on some airlines they treat them the same as electronics even though they are not being used with any other device, so that can be a drawback if you want them for noise cancelling the entire fligght. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:

Cons: Cost
I had a pair of the Sony MDR-NC50 for 3 years. They still worked ok but I wanted something lighter and louder. I purchased the newer Sony MDR-NC60 and returned them the same day. There was a loud pulsating thump in the right earpiece when the NC is activated. Others have had the same issue in the reviews. Listened to the Beats in the store and liked the build quality, but were too heavy and way too much bass for my taste. I bought the QC-15's and utter bliss! Light, just enough bass, crisp high's, one AAA battery to power a rechargeable will also work, they also can go much louder on my notebook and nano than my old Sony's. Try them for 30 days, return them if you don't like them. YOU WON'T!

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:

He has had them for several weeks now and they seem very durable, but he is being very careful with them. The AAA battery lasts a long time, but you'll want to keep an extra on hand if you're going on vacation. The noise cancelling feature is excellent. They come with a really nice hard storage case.

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:

The quality is excellent and wonderful for listening to music on my iPod Nano. Feel the price of the headphones was worth the price for what you get. Loved the sturdy, black case the headphones come with as well as the adaptor to use on most airlines.

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound quality and comfort
Cons: Low battery indicator
Out of other ear buds, surround sound stereos, and full aftermarket car audio systems, these headphones have the best sound quality I've ever experienced. The bass is not overwhelming and I can hear subtle details in all kinds of music that I have never noticed before. For those curious about the "noise cancellation" the headphones do not block out all ambient sound, but what they do is silence subtle background noises like air conditioning hum, refrigerator compressors, etc. And the only way you will hear anything through them is by turning them on, and there is no ability to play music without the noise cancellation turned on. The level of noise cancellation is adjustable on the plug that goes into the headphone ... s themselves but there is no way to make adjustments if you are wearing them without either of the headphone cables plugged into them. I'm a medical student and primarily use them to listen to podcasts of lectures and by themselves during tests to help decrease ambient noise. With all that being said they are extremely comfortable and seem very sturdy and well built. My only real complaint is the low battery indicator. There is a small green light above the on/off switch on the right headphone which tells you the headphones are turned on. When the battery begins to get low the light will start to blink green and the only way to know this is to take the headphones off and look. So you really only know the batteries are almost going to die if the sound or noise cancellation cuts out while you are listening to them. I go about 5-7 days between having to change out the batteries. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Quality, Awesome Sound
Spending a lot of time on aircraft I was looking for something to drown out the sound. The QC series does just that. My last 2hr trip on a C-130 military aircraft was somewhat nice due to these headphones.
This product comes with a case for extra protection. Extra cables, batteries and an iPOD fit great. There is also the option of using these in General Aviation aircraft. The "uflymike" can be installed for use in 2 prong aviation radios with the option of attaching a cell phone or MP3 player. I use this combo in prop fixed wing aircraft with no issues.
The sound is excellent, full base and crisp treble with defining mids. Most output will not blow out the speakers over time. The leather ear pad is comfortable and does not cause you ... to sweat. Overall amazing quality, you get what you pay for but well worth it in the end. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: The Best Bose has to offer (for now...) !
Item.Review:
Pros: Noise Cancellation, style, sound quality, iPhone cord
Cons: Cords that are included tangle up easily, unlike Beats by Dr. Dre Studio's cords
Apart from being a Beats by Dr. Dre Studio fan for a few months now, I have been a Bose owner since late 2008, when I got my first pair of QC 2 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones. Since then I have owned 5 pairs of the QC 15s due to battery issues, so my warranty is virtually endless.
Apart from the battery issues, these headphones are currently the best out there that Bose makes. With a few enhancements to the noise cancellation, they could be better, but for now they're still the best.
Bose first came out with these cans in the summer of 2009. I got these for Christmas of 2009, and since then I have loved every pa ... ir that I've gotten. The noise cancellation is so good both with and without plugging them into my iPhone, MacBook Pro, or iPod Touch that I can barely hear anybody else speaking.
Ideally with new enhancements Bose could make these cans literally completely noise cancelling. If I had to design and engineer these headphones I'd keep the same design, but I'd engineer these to the max in order to literally make sure that you cannot hear a thing. But that's my dream, and it'll probably never happen.
Anyway now back to the cans. The sound quality is excellent. The case is sturdy. The cans are comfortable. The only thing that annoys me is the cords that come with the cans. They can get tangled up super easily, unlike Beats by Dre's cords, which don't tangle at all. The iPhone cable is great in terms of the sound quality. When you are talking to someone it's almost like the Bose Bluetooth Headset. You and the other person can hear each other very well.
The bass on these cans is impressive. Now they're not up to par with the Beats by Dr. Dre Studios that I own, but they're still great in terms of the audio quality.
If you're looking for a good pair of noise cancelling headphones for going on a trip by plain, train, car, boat, or bus, then the Bose QC 15s are your best bet. They're the best that Bose has to offer until a newer model is announced, which is ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Value, Noise Cancellation, Bose Sound, iPhone compatible
Cons: No quarter inch connector
I bought these after returning a disappointing set of Monster Beats by Dr Dre Pro Special Edition Detox headphones which I had purchased for $499. By comparison, these are certainly an excellent value for the price. At $200 less than the Beats - these headphones outperformed the Beats in every way that I can think of except one. The Beats came with a mini to quarter-inch adapter and the QC15's don't include this. The QC's come with an additional iPhone cord (with a mic) which is nice to have.
The sound quality is good. One is that I noticed that these headphones sound best at higher volumes. At the higher volumes - the sound quality is thilling and encouraged me to spend ... much time under these headphones - wanting to hear things that I haven't listened to in years just to hear them through these phones. Look, we all know what the Bose sound is - and these are Bose sound plus better mids than Bose sound. if you like the Bose sound #and I do# you'll love these phones.
At lower volumes, there is nothing to really complain about - but they didn't thrill they same as they do at the higher volumes. To my ear, this is true of many Bose products so I kind of expected this. I could be wrong but there were a couple of moments that I thought that I could detect a little bit of the noise cancellation bleed through for a brief instant during a very quiet part of a song. I can't be sure - and there's little way to know as you can't turn the noise cancellation off as far as I know. Even if this were true - the sound was still extremely good but these are the only reasons that I didn't go to excellent.
Also - I should note that this is my first set of noise cancelling headphones. The noise cancellation is nothing short of amazing. If all you want is a little quiet, you don't even need to plug in the phones to any audio source - just put on the phones and turn them on. I can't wait for my next flight.
I wavered between good and excellent on Comfort. These headphones are light and ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural

1) The main reason I bought these was for noise cancellation and wow it does not disappoint. BUY THEM!!! expand » « collapse

I was seriously considering the Klipsch headphones (priced at $150). My main concern was that many owners of them complained about the comfort after a few hours. This was a problem that I had with my previous headphones, and I HATED it! I decided to take the dive and spend $300 on these Bose QC15's. The GOOD...the sound quality is AMAZING. I use them with my iPhone and I travel alot. I put them on and was instantly amazed. My daughter was talking to me and I could barely hear her. When music is playing then that is ALL you hear MUSIC!!
A good test is to listen to Jay-Z / Empire state of mind with ... regular headphones and then use the Bose. You will instruments and beats that you did not know was there before...
I compared over a month against the Dr. Dre Studio pair. I purchased these for several reasons. The noise canceling is better! I don't know the science of it but Beats just seemed to be more of a passive noise canceling versus active. Lastly Durability...the feel of the Bose is more sturdy. Also I went to 3 Best Buys in my area and all of the Beats demos were broken. Yes they were displays but the the Bose were not and for $300 they should take the abuse. Build quality: These are solid rock, they feel very durable and the materials are top quality. The carrying case is also great, makes you feel the headphones are safe. The cord is detachable and feels very durable too. 10 out of 10.
Comfort: The qc15 are comfortable for sure. The ear cushions are super soft. I wear them for hours and keep enjoying them like i just put them on. They might get a little bit hot after long use but it is not a significative thing to me. Seriously, super comfortable hp. 10 out of 10.
Audio quality: My fisrt impression was WOW. Seriously, these hp sound awesome , they made me want ... to listen to my whole library again. In some songs you might want to use the eq of your iphone/ipod (bass booster). Don't get me wrong, the bass is there, very warm and clear, but if you like a mind blowing bass you may be disappointed. The clears are crisp and the vocals are excellent. You'll hear things that you've never noticed before on your favorite songs. 9.5 out of 10.
Noise cancelling: Okay, this is a very personal opinion so you might want to try these before buying them. The noise cancelling is great, not perfect but great. They definitively block out a lot of noise. You can still hear people talking though, but once you start playing your music everything will fade away. Some people feel a pressure when using noise cancellng, I personally don't care since they dont' make me feel uncomfortable. Overall noise cancelling means less noise-more music. 9.5 out of 10.

Now for home use i don't think it was worth 300 dollars. but my main use for them is for work. i work around noisy machinery (and my employer lets us listen to music.) these machines run about 80-90Dbs. enough to make your ears ring slightly after working near them for 8 hours. i don't like the hearing protection they provide us. not very comfo ... rtable. but the QC 15 are super comfortable and as soon as i turn them on. boom major noise reduction. as soon as i put them on i enter another world. i feel like i am not at work anymore. but in a music video. and yes i can still perform my job. but these make the 300 dollors worth it and makes my job more fun. i love them. and in car rides. instead of hearing the car in the background of my music i hear crystal clear music. these are not the best sound quality out there. the beats is better sound quality. but Bose QC 15 has better noise canceling.(my friend has the beats) so if you want good quality music but doesn't have to worry background noise get the beats. but if you want to listen to music with out background noise get the QC 15. honestly, if not for work i would have no reason to have the QC 15 so if you buy then have a reason to get them. or you might not be satisfied with them. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfort and Noise Cancellation
Cons: I'm pretty sure $100 of the price is for the 'Bose' name.
My wife bought these for me a year ago. I use them daily for things like watching Video CBT's at work/home, music and TV. I watch all my 'personal' shows (mostly SciFi and such) in my own little man cave, always with headphones. I must have logged over 700 hours of use with these things over the last year. Except for a cord issue they are extremely durable and remain extremely comfortable to wear. I like to let people at work and such put these on and flip the switch. The noise cancellation always trips everyone out. I'd say 95% of people out there have never tried noise cancelling headphones. Normally open can headphones sound the best but they leak noise outward and leak out ... side noise inward. I'd say overall these exceed the sound quality of open can headphones and elminate almost all sound leakage (either way).
RECOMMENDATION: -As with all headphones, I'd suggest the first thing you do is Armor-All the cord, and repeat every month or two. The cord will be protected from cracking/drying and will also remain much more flexible. -After 1 months of heavy use where I used a heavy coiled extension cord for TV viewing, the cord began to pull out away from the plug exposing wire. It's $15 to order a replacment (no big deal). I'd just be careful about pulling on the cord or using something like a heavy extension. I also ordered the $15 lightweight bose matching extension and all is well now.
BAD: -In general the sound quality is about the same as a $100 pair of headphones (before noise cancellation). Specifically I own a pair of $100 Sennheiser open-can headphones and the sound quality on these isn't much better. I really take it as $100 for sound quality and $200 for noise cancellation (probably $100/$100 + $100 for the 'Bose' name). -The base is over-done but I like it -In some people the noise cancellation signal tricks the ear into sensing pressure. I never noticed this but it drives my wife crazy. She can't stand to wear them. Supposedly a couple of days of use wil ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Love them. You get what you pay for.
Item.Review:
Pros: Fantastic noise reduction and comfort.
Like many, I relied on earlier reviews for both these and the Dr. Dre Beats. I don't think there can be a clear winner - it's all about personal preference. After reading tons of reviews, I came to the conclusion: If you love hip-hop or rap with huge bass - then get the Beats. If not, get the QC15s.
My biggest deterrent to the Beats was the MANY comments about the noise leak. I experience none of that with these QC15s. I can watch a movie with these headphones blasting, and my wife can sit next to me on the couch watching a movie on netflix on her iPad. She doesn't hear my movie and I don't hear hers.
I like to listen to my music loud - I found out after having these headphones that the only reason I liked to have it so loud ... is so I would only hear the music. With these headphones, I can hear only the music, and I don't need to have the volume so loud. It’s fantastic.
As far as noise canceling, I think some reviewers were expecting earplugs, not headphones. They do a FANTASTIC job of blocking out ambient noise like our office’s server room, heating and most important to me – other coworkers! If someone comes into your office to speak with you, or your phone rings, you can easily hear it – but that is the point. What it does block out very well is the “hum” that you get with an office full of people speaking in their own offices. Without music on (but the headphones on) I can barely hear even my own typing or clicking. With music playing, I cannot hear myself type or click. It’s very relaxing. The noise canceling to me is very good. I’ve never heard better.
The headphones are the most comfortable pair I have ever had. I have worn them for hours at a time and they feel great. Very good job there.
Sound quality is great in my opinion. With these, I can tell a much bigger difference when I change the equalizer differences on my iPod and computer. I think my songs sound great and I can hear things very clearly. Much better than any headphones I’ve ever had before. ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: The best of the best, at any price.
Item.Review:
Pros: Excellent sound, true noise canceling tech, comfort!
Cons: Your ears may get warm.
So $300 is a lot of dough for headphones right? I was skeptical that the QC15s would live up to the hype. Then I wore them on a LA to NYC flight, and after enjoying 5hrs of quiet, gentle music I arrived refreshed and more comfortable than I've ever been after a long flight. Knowing what I know now, I would pay almost double for these headphones.
The reviews don't lie. CNET and many other consumer sources call the QC15s the best headphones money can buy.
Do you want the real thing or an imitator? I've tried other noise canceling headphones, and they were good. The Bose 15s are the best. You'll know where your money went when you wear these on an airplane and flip the "ON" swi ... tch.
There are only 2 drawbacks you should know about. 1) because the earpieces wrap around your ears, your ears may become hot/sweaty during extended listening. 2) the noise canceling technology creates a negative pressure inside the earcup, which is slightly noticeable but not at all bothersome to me.
Pluses: the material Bose found for the earcups and headband covering is like magic. So comfortable! Flip the on switch and the dull roar of an airplane suddenly disappears. Even during take-off. It's almost spooky how quiet things get. You can also use the headphones w/out the cord attached if you want pure silence rather than music, which is a cool feature.
I can't recommend these enough. If price is your only concern, move on. If high quality sound reproduction with the best noise canceling technology is important, buy these! expand » « collapse

Pros: Utter Silence
Cons: Battery
Pros: Comfort, Style, 'Bose' Satisfaction Guarantee, Noise Cancellation, Voice options, Ipod options
Cons: Battery required (but not to bad, avg of 35hours)
I'm not entirely new to noise canceling headphones, but when I needed a pair to go to London, a 10 hour flight, I new I had to go with Bose. I use to have an old pair, but the design didn't quite work for me. You needed an AUX cable, that didn't stay in, and the pads touched my ears, which don't go well with someone with glasses.
But OMG these headphones are fricken amazing. No only do they fit around my ears they are perfect when it comes to sound cancellation. The built in microphones (the ones on the outside and inside of the ears) are the best idea they came up wi ... th. Also, the cord that connects 'clicks' in and stays in. Also, there is a 'Hi,Low' option for flights. Lo to prevent the huge volume in planes have and Hi for everyday use.
Usually, I need to have my headphones at max volume to hear the entertainment on a plane, which can strain your ears, but with Bose, I never go past 30% volume. I could hear everything perfectly and I couldn't hear the engines of the plane as I rode to and from London.
There is also the optional microphone for skype calls, phone calls, and volume control for iphones. Very useful since I usually don't like showing strangers that I have such a device on me when traveling. But it does look like I'm talking to myself. Just a bit crazy.
The only thing I didn't like about these headphones was the fact that a battery is required to hear anything, but for the amount of time I used these things, I still haven't changed the battery and it has been more than 35 hours of use. I know I'll have to change it soon, but I'll know when cause there won't be anymore sound in the headphones.
Lastly, Bose has a 30 satisfaction guarantee and a no interest payment plan. For that I was willing to try them out while I was traveling and return them if I didn't like them. But I know that I'm keepin ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Everything
Cons: Nothing
First I want to start by saying that this is a Bose product, you get what you pay for. They're $300 for a reason... they sound amazing. I was wavering between these and the beats. I use them for Music, Gaming, Movies, basically everything on my PC because I don't want to disturb anyone and I wanted great sound.
Pros:
1) Sound Quality - It's typical Bose, it looks quiet on the outside and blows you away when you listen to it. The sound is perfectly balanced, the bass on the Beats was a bit much for constant use.
2) Comfort - These are the most comfortable headphones I've ever worn. They're extremely lightweight but well built. I noticed a lot of reviews on here knock the quality of this product but if you actually closely exa ... mine it, you will notice just how much thought actually went in to creating this product.
3) Noise Cancellation - I have never worn NC headphones before, but I must say it is extremely impressive; I can play Call of Duty on my PC and hear every little footstep while my girlfriend watches T.V. 3ft away from me and only hear my game.
4) Simplicity - I had purchased the $250 Tritton Pro Call of Duty headset prior to purchasing this, as well as some Turtle Beach headsets; all of which were designed to work great for gaming and provide the best performance. With all of their wires and fancy boxes they didn't even come close to sounding as good as these headphones and all I had to do was plug these in.
Bose has created a customer for life, I found it amusing that they include business cards for you to give people who ask you about your headphones. They know what they make is amazing, and they don't apologize for the price. I don't blame them :) expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: excellent noise cancelling
Cons: bass notes aren't as deep as some other headphones i've tried
Overall these are very good headphones. I was looking at several sets of noise-cancelling headphones for when I travel. These, by far, did the best job in that regard. The only real drawback is that some of the other sets I tried had much deeper and more powerful bass. Not a huge issue for me, but it may be for others.

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Very soft headphones
Cons: After using it for a couple hours your ears start to sweat
Overall a great product. It is a bit pricey but your paying for a great product. As for sound quality it is very good. The sound is clear and precise. I do not hear any outside noise. Also it is great for plane rides where babies are crying on the plane. I just put these headphones on and I can finally take a nap w/o hearing a baby cry.
The only negative thing I have to say is that your ears start to sweat after using it for more than about 3-4 hours. Also the battery dies quickly if you do not forget to slide the button to off, which I always forget to do.

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Very Comportable
Cons: Nothing
These headphones are great. They feel great and they sound awesome. I also love the noise cancellation feature. It's great for noisy atmospheres and your music just sounds so much better then other headphones on the market. They also have the perfect amount of bass so they don't hurt your ears.

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound Quality, Noise Canceling
Cons: Too much plastic
I fly out of state weekly for business and get asked frequently 'ARE THEY AS GOOD AS THEY SAY?' or 'ARE THOSE THOSE ONES I SEE ON TV?' - they are and their better when you hear them yourself!
The noise canceling is the best on the market - and this is statistacally proven, period. When Im allowed to turn them on at 10,000 ft. the sound of the engines nearly vanishes! You can still hear people talking. In fact you can hear the captian talk over the intercom better than if they were off. These headphones were not made to cancel the spoken word, but white, grey and I think pink noise (such as a fan or swamp cooler and such). The sounds that make your ears ring (tinitis) after a while. The saddest part of flights ... is when your ears get adjusted to the quiet and you have to shut them off for a landing - when you take them off the engines sound 2x louder.
Sound quality is more important to me than any feature. Honestly I bought a pair of $200 Sony headphones that ended up getting returned. I spent the extra $100 for these due to the fact I could HEAR the difference. If you enjoy classical, or any high fidelity audio then these are made for you. Roubust BASS, clear trebel and mid tones. You also hear every nuance so much deeper in audio tracks that were lost with such lousy sound equipment. You will want to re-listen to a lot of your music after getting these. THANK YOU BOSE! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Noise cancelling feature is simply awesome
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound quality and background noise elimination
Cons: Dropping $300 on headphones isn't easy, short battery life
Overall, the Bose QC 15 headphones are fantastic and they work as designed by eliminating the majority of background noise. To earn a little extra money, I recently started transcribing audio for a legal transcription business. At first, I used an older set of headphones and they worked well, but every time the A/C came on, the refrigerator ran, the dishwasher ran, or my wife watched TV, I had to deal with the background noise and distractions. I decided to get a new pair of headphone and immediately thought of these. The only thing that made me hesitate was the $300 price tag, but after some product testing in a noisy Best Buy store, I was sold. I took the ... m home and started using them right away. The result was awesome. I was able to concentrate on the transcription work and was able to get more done in less time. Other than the high price tag (the only reason I didn't give it a '5' in each category), the only negative thing I can think of is the seemingly short battery life. The headphones use a single AAA battery to power the noise cancelling feature. I was a bit surprised how quickly I had to replace the first one. The second battery didn't last much longer. Eventually, I got better at remembering to turn the feature off when I wasn't using the headphones, but the battery life was still relatively short. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Durable; Clear Sound; Versatile
These headphones are great! Was torn between the Dr.Dre studios but decided after going to my local electronic store to check them out.
Bottom Line: Best prices are with Buydig.com!

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Amazing Quality w/ durability & hearing protection
Item.Review:
Pros: Design
This is my second pair of Bose headsets and they never disappoint. The quality as usual is great, the case makes transportation easy and the battery life is good for hearing protection.

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: I wish I had purchased years earlier
Item.Review:

Cons: A little pricy
I purchased these as a present to me for my 70th birthday and for an upcoming flight to the west coast. I expected them to work well on the plane and they did. They are very comfortable to wear. I decided to try them when mowing the lawn instead of my normal hearing protection. I could clearly hear the music over the sound of the mower. The amount of noise reduction is amazing! I use them with my Ipod and Kindle Fire of if I just want it to be quiet when I read.

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Remarkably comfortable and the noise canceling technology really works well by blocking out the background din but not the unique sounds such as someone trying to get your attention. They're light weight and the ear cups are soft and don't apply too much pressure. Sound quality seems to be good, but I haven't put them through their acoustical paces, yet. My only complaint so far is the cord, which is very short.

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: very comfortable
Cons: batteries die in 36 hours
I love these. I wear them at work every day. They are very comfortable. Great sound quality, and good low-frequency cancellation.

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Quality of sound
Cons: Price
I have been watching this headphones for almost two years, waiting for their price to drop...
Well, as the price still is high, and three trips to make in a row, so decided to buy one.
Very good!

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Quiet, No sound spill in or out. Nice long cord, comfort
Cons: Pretty pricey and battery needs weekly replacement.
These headphones are amazing. I am a little hard of hearing and my wife can hear over Apple earbuds when I listen to my music/audio-books with them. She never says a word when I use the Bose product. The sound is fantastic and it totally blocks out out-side noise. The Phone and Play and Volume buttons on the cord are very sturdy and I haven't had any problems. I have yet to use them on an airplane flight but I am looking forward to doing that on Saturday.

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Clear sound Battery life is good. I probably have 50 - 60 hours on the stock battery right now and they are still going strong. I use them at work to kill all the background noise and other co-woorkers on their phones. I use them when I cut the grass. I don't have to have the headphones blasting my ears to hear the music. I would recommend to anyone.
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: The noise canceling woLrks and sound is great.
Item.Review:
Pros: The noise canceling and sound are terrific.
Cons: A bit expensive. You have to have the noise canceling on in order for the sound to work.
These headphones are great for plane rides and for blocking out noisy air conditioning. I just wish I didn't always need to use the noise canceling (hence killing the batteries) in order to get any sound out of them. I do like to use them around the house where noise canceling is not needed so it would be nice to not waste the battery life. But they are a great headphone in general and it definitely makes my plane trips better.

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfort and sound
Cons: Style
I went back and forth between these and Beats Studio. I tried them both on over and over again. If you want to look cool, get Beats. If you want the most comfortable, light weight, best sounding, best noise canceling headphones, get these. I use these in an office full of talking people, when I turn these things on I don't hear anything but whats coming through the headphones. I have also used these while cutting the grass and they make my lawnmower sound like an electric, its crazy. The comfort and noise canceling is ridiculous, Flat Out!

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: simple and comfortable to use
Cons: travel case is quite big
It turns a journey in Economy Class into a Business Class. It makes the difference after 8 and 12 hrs of flight. You can use it alone with out any music or you can plug to ANY entrainment device aboard. The quality of sound is very good. It's light and soft, and you don't mind using it again after you take them of for a wile. You can also have a soft conversation without rising the volume of your voice on a plane. Case is a little big. Bose can add some pockets and so for air tickets, passports and pens, since the size wont be smaller.

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Great noise cancellation and excellent playback of music
Cons: Price is a bit hefty, but considering the other alternatives the only choice for headphones
Although the price is a bit hefty, considering they are Bose headphones, you come to expect a pricier set of headphones.
I was looking for a set of noise cancellation headphones to use when I am operating my tractor or riding mower. After looking at the selection and reading the reviews, this seemed to be the best choice. As soon as you turn the switch on to the headphones, you immediately will notice a significant decrease in ambient noise.
I tried them the next day while riding my mower (rear engine, which blares in my ears), flipped on the noise cancellation and noticed a dramatic decrease in the nois ... e levels. So far, so good. Now to test them out with music...
The set comes with 2 cords, one for normal phone jacks, and one designed for an iPod. I have a no-name brand mp3 player so used the regular cord to plug in to the set. You must have the headphone switch to the on (noise cancellation) setting to be able to listen to external music devices. Prior to this set I used to have to turn my volume up all the way to drown out the noise from the mower and tractor, even then I could not hear the music very well, and it also lead me to get tinnitus (ringing in the ears). With the Bose Noise Cancellation headphones, I am now able to drown out the engine noises and play my music at half to less-than-half volume as previously played.
Great comfort too, as the phones hug the ears without leaving indentations or causing any discomfort in comparison to other earphones. I wore mine for over 4 hours while working on my tractor without any discomfort.
The headphones run on one (1) AAA battery and after many hours of use the original battery I placed in it is still working. Apparently it is not a battery hog.
So if you are looking for great headphones for use while working around noisey equipment I recommend these Bose headphones. Great sound!!! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound quality and comfort.
Cons: has to have AAA battery
The noise canceling ability of these headphones is great. I can tune out airplane noise when traveling for more relaxing trips, and more importantly I can tune out the communal music and ambient sound of my open work place while I listen to my own music. :) These are much more comfortable than earbuds!!! They're expensive, but worth the money.

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Were not comfortable enough for my big head
Item.Review:
Pros: Noise cancelling
Cons: Not so comfortable
I have a big head, I know that. I kept reading about how comfortable the Bose QC15 were so I thought I would spring the $300 to get them. They weren't painful but for that much money I shouldn't have to take them off every 20 minutes (if that) to relieve the pressure. I am not sure if it was the noise canceling that was bothering me or the fit. Either way, they weren't comfortable enough to justify the price. I also tried the QC3's and they were no better. Guess I'll stick with ear buds....

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: noise reduction
Cons: a bit sweaty after awhile
I love my headphones and use them many times a day to listen to audiobooks. I had to learn to remember to urn off the headphones; that isn't instinctive. I can now listen to books while walking on my noisy treadmill. I also use the headphones, without an MP3 player, when the music is too loud at hockey games. I try very hard to protect my remaining hearing.

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Noise Cancelling, but not 100% silent
Item.Review:
Pros: Does what it says it'll do - sounds great - nice case
Cons: price - but worth it.
I bought these for a flight to FL & back. I really have only used them twice so far. They deadened the engine noise by about 90% and almost completely with soft music playing. Where I was most thankful for them was the crying kids behind me. Another 90% noise reduction (and 100% sanity improvement). When I kicked up the music just a hair the baby disappeared. Great comfortable headphones but a bit pricey.

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Clear Sound; Lightweight; Amazing sound; Easy Controls
Cons: Hurts my head after 1 hr
This is a great product. The Bose name comes with high expectation of quality. The only thing keeping me from giving it a 5 is that my head and ears start to ache after about an hour of listening. They are light weight so I think it has something to do with the noise cancellation.

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Noise Cancelling, Good Sound Quality
Item.Review: The noise cancelling feature is outstanding in my opinion. I work in data centers where the fan noise is, to say the least, excessive. While these headphones have nice, crisp, clear sound quality, they do leave a bit to be desired in the overall volume output. However, when so much of the background noise is reduced, it really is a non-issue for myself. These are not inexpensive headphones, but I would definitely recommend them if your main goal is to reduce noise in a mostly white noise type environment. I use the microphone with my iPhone and the sound quality (as reported by the people I converse with) is fair to good quality.

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: sound quality, noise canceling, comfort, long cord
I did alot of research before buying my first pair of noise canceling headphones. i actually went with able planet and after having them for a few weeks i sold them on ebay and purchased the bose pair. 100 times better if you are traveling on a plane more than 10 times a year, you must have these! the bass quality isn't the best, so i don't use these for causal listening.

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound quality!
Cons: Can't think of any.
Definitely worth the cost. The sound quality is amazing. Bose continues to put out outstanding products. I would highly recommend this product for home and travel.

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: The noise canceling function is, by itself, outstanding. Combined with the crisp, luscious audio that these headphones provide make them a must have for travelers, or if you are often it noisy areas. Even if you're not in noisy areas, these headphones are amazing. I am a huge "bassophile" meaning I love bass, but the bass comes through on these headphones so well that you don't need bass boost or any bass amplification. I have the EQ on my iPhone set to Rock, and it sounds like a dream.

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfort with excellent noise cancellation
Cons: I don't have any complaints.
Silence! How sweet the sound. That is what you get with these. Put them on even in what you think is a silent room, and you will still be amazed as to how quiet it gets. Aside from canceling out sound around you, the sound quality is simply astounding. Bose continues to live up to its name by providing the highest quality sound in a device. I would not give these up for any other brand at any price. I wish they were cheaper, but the price has to be paid for comfort, noise cancellation, and sound quality that just can not be found in any other headphones. You will be extremely pleased with these headphones.

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound, Comfort, Durable, Case, Vertical/Angled Input Jack
Cons: Price, Won't work without Noise Cancel active, More insulation to keep sound within Ear space.
I did alot of research, figured I wouldnt spend $300 on headphones, but wanted something when I go on road trips and or study at starbucks. These headphones are without a doubt incredible. Sound Quality is good, comfort (even for me with larger than average ear size) is great. Price could come down some, but still worth every penny. I would be nice if you could use them without the noise cancelling as well, but it probably wouldnt sound as good. The reason they are so clear is because all outside noise is actively reduced to literally nothing. I can't even hear myself talk when listening to my Iphone. The one thin ... g that bugs me is when people can hear what I listen to, I know it's asking alot, but with these headphones, you can hear what someone is listening to. With the active cancelling, you can turn the music down and never hear the outside world, while not bothering everyone around you. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: These are even better than the QC15s I replaced.
Item.Review: Incredible ambient sound deadening and extremely true and pure reproduction of the sounds I want to hear. Listening to music or a movie on a plane completely isolates me from the noise going on around me. I love them.

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Noise canceling, comfort, ease of use, battery life, travel case, and did I mention the noise cancelation?
Cons: Bass at loud volumes and unfortunately quite loud from the exterior allowing people to hear what you hear.
I put some thorough research into these before I bought these. After I finally listened to them, they blew away my expectations. From the moment you turn the headphones on everything in the world just stops. Bose invented noise cancelation and they seriously upped their game from their previous models making this masterpiece. As the name says QuietComfort, they do just that. They are the most comfortable and silent over the ear headphones out there. These headphones are a little loud do to their speaker configuration which means other people around you c ... an hear what you are listening to but honestly, who cares? At high volumes the bass does get a little distorted and sounds a bit "bright" but with the noise cancelation half volume on anything should suffice. These are a great buy and deserve some serious credit, mad props to Bose. Anyone who is comparing between this and the Dr.'s Beats should go with this no question. Don't jump to the Beats for the brandname. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Great headphones, but a little pricey
Item.Review:
Pros: Cancels nearly all ambient sound and provides excellent quality
Cons: Price, has to be 'on' in order to hear anything.
I use these headphones exclusively on the airplane and what a difference they make. Before these, I had a set of $30 earbuds (not cheap, but not top of the line) and I used to have to crank my iPod up to the max in order to hear podcasts clearly when on the plane. With these headphones, I no longer have to do that. The sound quality is very good and they cancel nearly all of the background noise when in use, but the price is a deterrent. One other downside is that they have to be turned 'on' in order for any sound to come out whatsoever, so they cannot be used during takeoffs and landings.

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Very comfortable to wear.
Cons: A bit pricey but still worth the money.
These headphones are great for noise reduction especially while flying in jet airplanes. Use of these headphones makes flying a lot more comfortable and relaxing. The noise reduction is the best and the quality of sound of the music is up with the best of quality headphones.

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Wonderful but not worth the price
Item.Review:
Pros: Everything
Cons: Cost too much
These headphones are superb in all aspects except one. They are not worth the price tag. They have excellent sound and comfort. They cut out background noise perfectly. There is nothing wrong with these headphones. It is a matter of personal preference to pay the price. I am returning them today just cannot justify the price I paid for them for how much I will use them or the sound quality. $300.00 is way too much for these. Sound is great but in reality they are not much better than the $29.99 pair of Sony earbuds I have owned for over 2 years. If I was a frequent traveler on aircraft I would keep them. Do not get me wrong they are very good quality headphone. It all comes down to personal preference. Do I or don't I you be the judge.

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural

HAVE TWO OF THESE IN THE FAMILY NOW AND MY SON AND WIFE LOVE THEM. THE NOISE REDUCTION AND SOUND QUALITY ARE EXCEPTIONAL. MY SON WAS SET ON BEATS UNTIL HE TRIED THE BOSE. MY SISTER-IN-LAW TRIED THEM AND IS NOW CONSIDERING A PAIR.

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Makes all the difference in the world flying
Item.Review:
Pros: eliminate background noise and deliver great sound
Cons: a hard case would provide more protection, price is high
I got these as a gift from work - I love them but I'd have a hard time paying $300 as well. $300 will buy an awful lot of alternative electronics.
That said, with the ipod, these are the greatest things ever invented for relaxing and passing time in airline glorified bus seats. Yesterday I let the person sitting next to me try them out - have done this before. I love to watch the reaction when they put them on with power off, then turn them on. I didn't realize the background noise wore on me so much until I started using them. I would never fly without them. I wouldn't trust the soft case in luggage either - I wear it around my neck and tuck my ipod ... in the sleeve outside. I generally don't wear them at home, though I have when doing yard work before. Sound quality is excellent - anyone that says it isn't top rate is trying to sell something else. I like the AAA battery - they last quite a while, and I keep a spare or two in the case. I can't recharge a battery in the middle of a 3 hour flight, and I can buy AAA batteries anywhere - so I woulldn't be interested in the newer model. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: It really does cancel out the noise of the airplane!
Before buying the Bose noise-canceling headphones, I had another name brand. The reason I had purchased the other brand was there were considerably cheaper than the Bose. When I tested them in the store, they didn't seem to have a huge difference from the Bose. After using them other brand for a couple flights, I found I wasn't impressed. I could still hear the roar of the plane when wearing them, they were slightly uncomfortable on my ears and they diminished the quality of the music. The quality of the music is important to me. With another flight coming up, I decided to bit the bullet and buy the more expensive Bose. I do not regret that decision. The technology that Bose uses to reduce the noise of the plane, does not re ... duce the quality of the music. I noticed that the Bose reduced the plane noise much more than the other name brand did. And, the Bose headphone also fit more comfortably over the ears, which is great on those longer flights. If quality of music and comfort are important, then the Bose noise-canceling headphones are the way to go! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural

These headphones are EVERYTHING they say they are, everything. Coolest of the cool - just wearing them and turning them on (batteries included) (no music - just on) ambient sound is removed and/or diminished greatly - Wow! How'd they do that? Who knows, but it works - amazing. WARNING: do not wear these while driving or ANYTHING in which hearing someone or something is necessary to your safety -YOU will not hear it !

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:

Others have great sound and decent NC, but I didnt think we're as portable, which is important if you travel a lot.

Cons: Price
Excellent sound quality and comfort - very good noise-cancelling for deep sounds, but not so much for high pitches. Music sounds terrific - my home has never been so quiet - what kids?

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: great sound
Cons: doesn't cancel noise

When we used them at home they don't cancel ANY noise by themselves without music, and with music on they only cancel a little bit of noise. We used them on a plane and the sound is great but it didn't really help with the background noise. It definitely didn't end up being worth the $300 dollars I spent on it.
