Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Everything
Cons: Price
I went back and forth between the beats by dre and the QC 15 for a very long time before finally deciding on the QC 15. The main selling point for me was the great noise canceling technology. It gets rid of almost every sound around me no matter what I am doing and really helps me to concentrate because of it. I am a college student and while putting up $300 for them was rough, it has paid off when trying to do homework or studying in a noisy environment. As soon as you put them on it's almost like everything stops all around you. I would highly recommend them!

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.ReviewTitle: Bose QuietComfort 15 Headphones are worth the $$$
Item.Review:
Pros: They're light, comfortable on ears, great ambient sound attenuation, awesome sound quality.
Cons: As usual with Bose products, they're overpriced. They cannot be used for music listening without a battery.
Having worked as a Telecommunications Tech. for 25 years and knowing the mechanics of 'noise cancellation' (It should actually be called 'Noise Attenuation') I have to say that the QC15 headphones do the best job at attenuating background sounds over the widest frequency range I've seen yet. Low level background sounds are virtually eliminated. The use of a single AAA battery limits the level of attenuation, allowing the louder sounds leak through but at a significantly lower volume. The sound quality when listening to music is everything you would expect from the Bos ... e brand name - "Superb", to put it in a single word.
The only issues I have with the QC15 headphones are The Price - you’re paying mostly for the Bose brand name – and the fact that they cannot be used for music listening without being ‘turned on’, requiring you to carry a spare battery or two whenever you’ll be using them. Battery life could be longer but considering the use of a single AAA battery I guess it’s pretty good as is. Some people have remarked on durability and they are right. You have to treat these, as well as the previous Bose headphone models, as if they are valuable and delicate precision instruments, which is pretty much the case since you’ve laid out big $$$ for them. Make use of the semi-hard case they come with when transporting them and don’t ‘stuff’ them into tight bags. Take good care of them and they will give you many years of quality service.
To sum up, the Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones live up to the Bose name in quality and performance. I wish Bose would bring their prices down but until they do, if ever, the QC15s are worth the investment for those who are looking for a great listening experience and can afford them. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: These headphones block out more of the white noise than the others that I have tried. So much so that I don't have to pump up the volume as much to get a clear, crisp sound. (No I don't work for Bose; I just appreciate great sounding equipment/product)

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound is near perfect.
Cons: TOO fragile!!! They wont last.
Sound is great sure... but what good is that when they are broken. -Pads wore down fast shedding little black pieces everywhere. -Pads blew out completely in two years of light use. -After the first year the metal strip broke clean through the plastic in the headband. (I was able to repair that) -Within a year and a half the swivel on the other side was broken. -Finally just short of two years and they are beyond repair. -Bose will not take care of me :(
I am VERY careful with my equipment. I always stored the phones in the case and never threw them around.
I have replaced them with Sony Noise Canceling Phones from Best Buy and I am happier. Even if they break... I literally buy ... 7 pairs of Sonys for the price of the Bose. ...and the sound quality is same.
Save your money. What is now old technology wrapped in cheap plastic is not worth it.
Have a nice day. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Sound quality, noise cancelling technology, comfortable fit
Cons: Nothing
I work for an airline. I have used this product often while traveling & at work during my breaks. The Bose QC 15 are the best headphones I have used to date. While traveling on aircraft the noise simply disappears. While on my breaks at work, in a very noisy environment, they help me to feel like I far away from all the stress of the job & load noise. The Bose QC 15 headphones are simply amazing, and I've tried numerous other products before buying Bose. There are some that some close to the performance of Bose. However, none match its superior sound quality & noise canceling technology.

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review:
Pros: Best Bose NC headphones yet...
Cons: $300 is $300...
IMO, these are excellent headphones... I can't say it any simpler than that. I work from home and I usually end up working late most nights. My office is right next to our bedroom and my GF usually goes to bed a good hour or 2 before I do. I just pop the QC 15's on and either plug them into my laptop or my Bose computer speakers so I can listen to iTunes or whatever... It is a win-win situation for both of us. It also helps me get more work done during the day as they help to block out all of the "distractions" one has when working from home.
The sound quality is very impressive. They are extremely comfortable too - at least they are for me. Not too bulky on my melon. I actually have to watch getting up from my ... desk with them still on - that is how good of a fit they are for me.
The only negative I can think of is that you need to watch the volume on your output source. It can leave a bit of a ringing in your ears if it's up too loud. At least that has been my experience. I guess for those not accustomed to NC technology, it can be a bit of an adjustment. And yes, they are a bit pricey, but I got them 18 months - no interest from BB... Not a bad deal at all. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural
Item.Review: Although everyone has different audio preferences when it comes to the sound quality they are looking for, I found that these headphones were excellent for me. What I first liked about them was the weight, they were light and did not feel like they were weighing my head down or feel like they were going to slip off. (I compared these with other Bose models and Beats by Dre headphones). It was also important that it had good sound, and this product delivered. It was also important to me that it really was truly noise cancelling. I was impressed with the technology and I can wear these in the office to do work and not be distracted or use them to listen to webinars. I also enjoy them at home when my boyfriend is playing video games and I want to block out the sound. This also help with the " ... fighting" for sound problem. I can not wait to use these on a flight! I will not use these at the gym. I have a cheaper pair of in-ear buds that I use for that. So if they break or I lose them I won't be heartbroken. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Bose QuietComfort 15 Acoustic Noise Cancelling - headphones - Ear-cup, Binaural

Premium sound: Noise-cancelling feature is superb and the fact that you can use these for just some quiet time without the cable connected is a nice feature. Only negative is that you have to have turn power on to hear music, all the more reason to carry an extra AAA battery. Plus, why else would you buy them if you aren't going to use the noise cancelling function?
